sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"承认"之意。
means: acknowledge ：通常指公开承认某事的真实情况或自己的过错。
admit ：强调因外力或良心驱使或经判断而明确承认，多含不情愿或被迫意味。
confess ：语气较强，着重承认自己意识到的错误或罪行，含坦白忏悔的意味。
recognize ：作"承认"解时，系书面用词，主要指合法的或外交上的承认，也指公认。
concede ：指在事实与证据面前勉强或不得不承认。

sentence.Network_en: You have to acknowledge that we live in a racist society.
sentence.Network_cn: 你得承认我们生活在一个有种族偏见的社会中。

sentence.Network_en: Doran stuck his head out of the window to acknowledge the cheering.
sentence.Network_cn: 多兰将头探出窗户向欢呼的人们致谢。

sentence.Network_en: Some of the clergy refused to acknowledge the new king'slegitimacy.
sentence.Network_cn: 一部分神职人员拒绝承认新国王的合法地位。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent.: from the obsolete Middle English  verb knowledge, influenced by obsolete acknow 'acknowledge, confess'

entry.def: If you acknowledge a fact or a situation, you accept or admit that it is true or that it exists.

example.ex: Naylor acknowledged, in a letter to the judge, that he was a drug addict...
example.tran: 内勒在给法官的信中承认自己吸毒。

example.ex: Belatedly, the government has acknowledged the problem...
example.tran: 政府迟迟才承认了该问题。

entry.tran: 公认，认可（某人的成就、地位、品质等）
entry.def: If someone's achievements, status, or qualities are acknowledged, they are known about and recognized by a lot of people, or by a particular group of people.

example.ex: He is also acknowledged as an excellent goalkeeper...
example.tran: 他也被公认为是一名出色的守门员。

example.ex: Some of the clergy refused to acknowledge the new king's legitimacy.
example.tran: 一部分神职人员拒绝承认新国王的合法地位。

entry.tran: 告知（信函等）的收到;确认…收悉
entry.def: If you acknowledge a message or letter, you write to the person who sent it in order to say that you have received it.

example.ex: The army sent me a postcard acknowledging my request.
example.tran: 军队寄给我一张明信片告知我的申请书已收到。

entry.tran: （以点头、微笑等）向…打招呼，理会
entry.def: If you acknowledge someone, for example by moving your head or smiling, you show that you have seen and recognized them.

example.ex: He saw her but refused to even acknowledge her.
example.tran: 他看见了她，却连招呼也不打。

entry.tran: （对掌声、赞扬、好意等作出姿态表示）感谢
entry.def: If you acknowledge someone's applause, compliments, or kindness you make a gesture in order to thank them or show your appreciation.

example.ex: Doran stuck his head out of the window to acknowledge the cheering...
example.tran: 多兰将头探出窗户向欢呼的人们致谢。

example.ex: She never even acknowledged the man who opened the door for her...
example.tran: 她对为自己开门的男士甚至连一点表示都没有。

means.word_mean: 1. declare to be true or admit the existence or reality or truth of;

sentences.sentence: "She acknowledged that she might have forgotten"
"The program committee acknowledged the submission of the authors of the paper"

means.word_mean: 3. express recognition of the presence or existence of, or acquaintance with;

sentences.sentence: "He never acknowledges his colleagues when they run into him in the hallway"
"She acknowledged his complement with a smile"
"it is important to acknowledge the work of others in one's own writing"

means.word_mean: 4. express obligation, thanks, or gratitude for;

sentences.sentence: "We must acknowledge the kindness she showed towards us"

means.word_mean: 5. accept as legally binding and valid;
6. accept (someone) to be what is claimed or accept his power and authority;

sentences.sentence: "The Crown Prince was acknowledged as the true heir to the throne"

auth_sentence.content: I couldn't acknowledge that I had a disability.
auth_sentence.res_content: I couldn't acknowledge that I had a disability.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I couldn't acknowledge that I had a disability.

auth_sentence.content: Even the quoted NICE guidelines for depression acknowledge this.
auth_sentence.res_content: Even the quoted NICE guidelines for depression acknowledge this.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Even the quoted NICE guidelines for depression acknowledge this.

auth_sentence.content: So acknowledge this reality, and keep doing science.
auth_sentence.res_content: So acknowledge this reality, and keep doing science.

Sentence.sentence: The latest congressional report acknowledges the critical importance of technical training, but also asserts that the study of the humanities (人文学科)and social sciences must remain central components of America's educational system at all levels.
Although many attribute Kodak's downfall to "complacency(自满) ," that explanation doesn't acknowledge the lengths to which the company went to reinvent itself.
When it gets a little boring, I might pull it out," acknowledged Naomi Pugh, a first-year student at Freed- Hardeman University in Henderson, Tenn.
Supervisors should acknowledge high performance so that the employee will continue to perform well in the future

If supervisors do not acknowledge such outstanding performance, employees may either lose their enthusiasm and reduce their effort or search for a new job at a firm that will reward them for high performance.

sentences.en: He grudgingly acknowledged having made a mistake.
I acknowledged him as an authority.

sentences.cn: 我们应当告诉他信收到了。

sentences.en: They wishes to acknowledge the assistance of the police in the making of this film.
sentences.cn: 他们希望鸣谢警方在拍摄此片中所给予的帮助。

means.word_mean: 对…打招呼，理会；答理；对…作出反应

sentences.en: I acknowledged his politeness with a bow.

means.word_mean: 【法律】公证；确认(债务等)，确认…有法律效力(或约束力)

jushi.english: She refuses to acknowledge the need for reform.
jushi.chinese: 她拒不承认改革的必要性。

jushi.english: We should always acknowledge gifts promptly.
jushi.chinese: 我们收到礼物就应立即致函表示感谢。

jushi.english: Please acknowledge receipt of this letter.
